questions.text: What does the duty of loyalty require of Covered Persons?

options.B: Act in good faith for the Corporation’s best interests

questions.explanation: Covered Persons must act in good faith and in the Corporation’s best interests.

questions.text: Which scenario most clearly represents a conflict of interest?

options.A: Director reads the agenda in advance
options.B: Director’s company bids on a contract being approved by the Board

questions.explanation: A financial interest in a transaction before the Board is a typical conflict.

questions.text: Who may vote on a compensation arrangement under review?

options.A: Any Director, including the person compensated
options.B: Only Directors with no conflict of interest
options.C: The compensated person if recused from discussion

questions.explanation: Approving members must be independent of the arrangement.

questions.text: Before approving compensation, the Board should:

options.A: Rely on comparable data from similar organizations
options.B: Ask the candidate to set their own pay
options.C: Skip data if the role is part‑time

questions.explanation: Comparable data helps establish reasonableness and avoid private inurement.

questions.text: When must Covered Persons disclose conflicts?

options.C: In writing and in good faith before consideration of the matter

questions.explanation: Conflicts are disclosed in good faith prior to Board review.

questions.text: Which documentation is appropriate for minutes in a conflict review?

options.B: Terms approved, attendance, data relied on, and safeguards

questions.explanation: Minutes should reflect key facts, attendance, data, and safeguards.

questions.text: Which is an example of private benefit/inurement?

options.A: Paying fair‑market compensation after independent review
options.B: Awarding a no‑bid contract to a Director’s company without safeguards

questions.explanation: Unreasonable insider benefit without independent process can be private inurement.

options.A: Allow conflicted members to vote but not speak

questions.explanation: Recusal plus independent review and documentation are common safeguards.
